answerText: Stern-Gerlach experiment[10] The results of the experiment were used by Pauli to predict that a quantum number representing this quantity, the intrinsic angular momentum of particles, could have a value of one-half.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 5 | 5 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The two scientists who performed this experiment smoked bad cigars full of sulfur, which made it very easy to see the distinct splitting pattern on the detection plate. For 10 points each:  [10] Name this 1922 experiment in which atoms fired through an inhomogeneous magnetic field had splitting patterns formed by their different magnetic moments.
